s.text: .. well, pretty much A. It's not so much that they're all saying the same thing--there are some substantive differences in their approaches to policy--as it is that the public has by now picked up the sense that those differences won't necessarily result in substantially different outcomes in the long run.

.. well, pretty much A. It's not so much that they're all saying the same thing--there are some substantive differences in their approaches to policy--as it is that the public has by now picked up the sense that those differences won't necessarily result in substantially different outcomes in the long run.

For an object lesson in the magic of Gersh Kuntzman, compare the Plaza-doorman stories in the News and the Post . Both papers do a fine job of hitting the guy's career highlights (the Beatles, Jackie Gleason, Lana Turner).
